title: Revolution Part 4 - Rebellion & Uprising
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Understanding the relationship between Revolution, Rebellion, Uprising, Protest, Demonstration, and Riot - the battles within the war

definitions.uprising: An act of resistance or rebellion; a revolt

rebellion.primary: An act of violent or open resistance to an established government or ruler
rebellion.secondary: The action or process of resisting authority, control, or convention

revolution.primary: A forcible overthrow of a government or social order in favor of a new system
revolution.secondary: A dramatic and wide-reaching change in the way something works or is organized
revolution.metaphor: Like Earth going around Sun - one full Revolution = one year

definitions.protest: A statement or action expressing disapproval of or objection to something
definitions.demonstration: A public meeting or march protesting against something or expressing views on a political issue
definitions.riot: A violent disturbance of the peace by a crowd

key_insight.war_vs_battles: Revolution is the War; Demonstrations, Riots, Uprisings, Rebellions are the Battles
key_insight.not_new: Revolution is not something new - has happened in pretty much every society ever
key_insight.distinctions: Revolution is not a Renaissance, not a Revival, not a Rebellion - but all may contribute to one

jefferson_quotes.rebellion_necessary: God forbid we should ever be 20 years without such a rebellion
jefferson_quotes.spirit_of_resistance: Liberties are ensured by the spirit of resistance

powder_alarm_1774.event: British Army attempted to seize Gunpowder from Magazine in Boston
powder_alarm_1774.response: Thousands went to Boston to protest
powder_alarm_1774.context: Gunpowder stored in structures called Magazines (like grain silos)

gandhi_salt_march.gathered: Hundreds of thousands along the way
gandhi_salt_march.action: Made Salt from Saltwater in defiance of British law
gandhi_salt_march.british_law: Banned personal creation of Salt, taxed sale of Salt
gandhi_salt_march.result: 60,000 arrested - Imperial system ground to halt

attica_prison_riot.action: Prisoners took over prison, took guards hostage, made demands
attica_prison_riot.comparison: Seen as similar to Kent State - Government overstepping authority

third_servile_war_spartacus.began_with: 70 slave-gladiators escaping from gladiator school in Capua
third_servile_war_spartacus.grew_to: 120,000 men, women and children within two years
third_servile_war_spartacus.achievement: Repeatedly defeated Roman military - local patrols to trained legions
third_servile_war_spartacus.rebellion_vs_revolution: If they had taken over Rome, would have been Revolution

rebellion_vs_revolution.final_step: Rebellion or Revolt is the final step in most Revolutions
rebellion_vs_revolution.spark: A Protest, Demonstration, or Riot can spark a Revolution
rebellion_vs_revolution.spartacus_example: If Spartacus had taken over Rome and become new rulers = Revolution, not just Rebellion

mob_and_riot_control.media_narrative: News always supports Police like a sport - talks about pushing people back
mob_and_riot_control.air_of_powerlessness: Talks about people as if they are powerless, just 'a Consumer'
mob_and_riot_control.reality: Rioters start breaking things, pushing cops back - no matter force, can't contain it
mob_and_riot_control.outcome: Sometimes police literally knocked to ground, unable to arrest anyone
mob_and_riot_control.media_reaction: Always sense of dread: 'How? This is horrible.'
mob_and_riot_control.cycle: Rebuild same confidence every time, shocked again next time

yippie_manifesto_18_points.context: Abbie Hoffman's testimony about why they came to Chicago
key_demands: End to Vietnam War, abolition of draft
Freedom for Huey Newton and all black prisoners
Legalization of marijuana and all psychedelic drugs
Prison system based on rehabilitation not punishment
Abolition of laws for victimless crimes
Abolition of money - free housing, food, education, healthcare
Full unemployment society - 'Let the machines do it'
Open and free use of media
Political system responsive to all people regardless of age, sex, race
Blank point for anyone to fill in
yippie_manifesto_18_points.closing: We recognize we are America; we are free men. We are the second American Revolution.

quiz_questions.q: What is the relationship between Revolution and Rebellion?
quiz_questions.a: Revolution is the WAR; Rebellion/Protest/Riot are the BATTLES within that war
quiz_questions.explanation: All may contribute to Revolution but Revolution is the full transformation

quiz_questions.q: What was the Powder Alarm and why is it significant?
quiz_questions.a: 1774 - British tried to seize gunpowder, thousands protested, British retreated - 2 years BEFORE Lexington
quiz_questions.explanation: Shows Revolution builds through smaller confrontations

quiz_questions.q: How did Gandhi's Salt March end British rule?
quiz_questions.a: 240 miles, gathered hundreds of thousands, 60,000 arrested - Imperial system ground to halt
quiz_questions.explanation: Nonviolent demonstration can be as powerful as armed rebellion

quiz_questions.q: Why is Spartacus called a Rebellion and not a Revolution?
quiz_questions.a: They didn't take over Rome - if they had become new rulers, it would have been a Revolution
quiz_questions.explanation: Revolution requires actual replacement of the system, not just resistance

quiz_questions.q: What cycle does @marsresident observe about riot coverage?
quiz_questions.a: Media builds confidence → gets shocked → rebuilds confidence → gets shocked again
quiz_questions.explanation: Media treats people as powerless despite evidence otherwise
